vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
πτωχ-εύω,
future -σω[Refs 8th c.BC+]: Epic dialect imperfect πτωχεύεσκον [Refs]:—to be a beggar, go begging, [prev. cited]; ἀνὰ δῆμον [Refs 7th c.BC+]
__2 to be as poor as a beggar, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__3 metaphorically with genitive, to be badly off for, πραγμάτων, of historians, [Refs 2nd c.BC+]
__II transitive, beg (for), δαῖτα [Refs 8th c.BC+]
__II.2 with accusative person, ask an alms of, φίλους [Refs 6th c.BC+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
to be or become poor
to be a beggar; to be, or become poor, be in poverty, 2Cor. 8:9*
